page.title: 06VALE OF CLWYD DAIRY FARMER.
page.content: The day starts 5.30a.m,when the 110 Friesians are milked with the help of one workman.This takes 2 hrs,and then the calves are fed.After breakfast slurry is cleared and bedding given.In the afternoon the farmer does general maintenance and veterinary work e.g. flu or blackleg injections,before evening milking.The cows are wintered indoors.This year there were{3 cuts of {silage of 80,50 & 30 acres in 5,3 & 2 {days respectively.}It is stored in a barn,& outdoors under polythene.30 acres of barley (for feed)are sown for 2 consecutive years,& grass re_sown next year,in{rotation.}The land is {fertilised with slurry,manure and {chemical.}Contractors are used for silage,corn,ploughing,hedging and ditching.No bull is kept a.l service is used.
